meanings.definition: To digest (food) partially before it reaches the stomach.
meanings.sent1: She predigests her food by chewing it thoroughly before swallowing.
meanings.sent2: The bird predigests its food by regurgitating and re-chewing it.
meanings.sent3: The picky eater predigests his food by carefully inspecting each bite.
meanings.sent4: The chef predigests the ingredients in his mind before starting to cook.
meanings.sent5: The mother bird predigests the food for her chicks to help them eat easily.

meanings.definition: To simplify or make easier to understand by breaking down complex information.
meanings.sent1: The teacher predigests the lesson by using simple examples.
meanings.sent2: The infographic predigests the data for quick comprehension.
meanings.sent3: The comedian predigests the joke so everyone can laugh without confusion.
meanings.sent4: The translator predigests the text to bridge the language barrier.
meanings.sent5: The storyteller predigests the plot twists for young readers to follow along.
